posts.post_content: Probably better than [Where Ancients Tread](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Where Ancients Tread), since it works with small creatures, too, and gives a bigger effect with bigger creatures. The higher cost probably isn't too big of a deal, if you're playing a deck that can support big enough creatures to make it worthwhile.
posts.html:
Probably better than Where Ancients Tread, since it works with small creatures, too, and gives a bigger effect with bigger creatures. The higher cost probably isn't too big of a deal, if you're playing a deck that can support big enough creatures to make it worthwhile.

posts.post_content: I'm confused as to how this functions with a living weapon. Will the germ get the added P/T before this hits the stack, since the equipment gets attached before checking state-based effects, or will it be added on the stack when it's still a 0/0? I feel like it would, since I anticipate cards that come in with +1/+1 counters would get to do their full damage.
posts.html:
I'm confused as to how this functions with a living weapon. I feel like it would, since I anticipate cards that come in with +1/+1 counters would get to do their full damage.

posts.post_content: [Genesis Wave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Genesis Wave) for six is probably lethal if you're running a playset of these. Generating nine mana in a creature-heavy RG deck is an exercise left to the reader - but not an overly complicated one. (Hint: start with [Solemn Simulacrum](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Solemn Simulacrum))
